text: How does Smalltalk (Pharo for example) compare to Python?
I've seen some comparisons between Smalltalk and Ruby on the one hand and Ruby and Python on the other, but not between Python and Smalltalk.
I'd especially like to know what the fundamental differences in Implementation, Syntax, Extensiabillity and Philosophy are.
For example Python does not seem to have Metaclasses.
Smalltalk has no concept of generators.
And although both are said to be dynamicly typed, I believe that Python does not do dynamic method dispatch.

childList.text: For example Python does not seem to have Metaclasses. Smalltalk has no concept of generators. And although both are said to be dynamicly typed, I believe that Python does not do dynamic method dispatch. Is this correct?
